sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都表示物品价格"高的，昂贵的"之意。
means: dear ： 侧重指要价过高，或远高于公道、合理的价格，其反义词是cheap。
expensive ： 指物品的价格超过了它本身所值，或超过了购买者的支付能力。
costly ： 指物品价格高，通常是因物品稀少或珍贵所致。

sentence.Network_en: I get very nervous because I'm using a lot of expensive equipment.
sentence.Network_cn: 因为正在使用很多昂贵的设备，所以我非常紧张。

sentence.Network_en: The case against is twofold: too risky and too expensive.
sentence.Network_cn: 反对理由有两点：太冒险而且太昂贵。

sentence.Network_en: They actually moved down from upstairs because the rent's that expensive.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们确实从楼上搬到了楼下，因为房租太贵了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'lavish, extravagant'): from Latin expens- 'paid out', from the verb expendere (see expend), + -ive

entry.def: If something is expensive, it costs a lot of money.

example.ex: Wine's so expensive in this country...
example.tran: 葡萄酒在这个国家非常昂贵。

example.ex: I get very nervous because I'm using a lot of expensive equipment.
example.tran: 因为正在使用很多昂贵的设备，所以我非常紧张。

means.word_mean: 1. high in price or charging high prices;

auth_sentence.content: Very expensive ones, though. white males?!?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Very expensive ones, though. white males?!?

auth_sentence.content: Toxins, though, are expensive to clean up.
auth_sentence.res_content: Toxins, though, are expensive to clean up.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Toxins, though, are expensive to clean up.

auth_sentence.content: Field testing of products is harder and more expensive.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =expend,表示"花费,支付"; 2. 最初意思为"称重量而衡量……",引申出花费,支付; 3. =hang,表示"悬挂"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可分配的,不是必要的,可有可无的
stems_affixes.word_buile: dispense分配+able可以……的→dispensable可分配的→能分送出去的,不重要的
ex出+pens花费,支付+ive……的→要花很多钱出去的
dispense分配+ary场地→dispensary分配[药]的地方→药房

stems_affixes.value_cn: 费用, 代价, 损失

stems_affixes.word_buile: pens花费,支付+ion表名词→用以花费,支付的
pro多+pens花费,支付+ity性质,特性→某[方面]花费的多→嗜好
suspense[v.担心;悬而不决]+ion表名词→n.悬挂,暂停,停职;悬[置]架
com全部+pens支付+ate表动词→为……而全部支付→赔偿
dis分开+pens花费+e→分开花费→分配[财富等]

Sentence.sentence: For now the app is also iPad-exclusive, and though a few of these educational institutions are giving the hardware away for free, for other students who don't have such a luxury it's an added layer of cost — and an expensive one at that.
That lets us avoid building costly plants or buying expensive power at peak usage time
Tax breaks bring the cost down, especially in California, but in many states ZEHs can be prohibitively expensive.

Piling on higher taxes won't help, "If higher taxes make it more expensive to raise children," says Nicholas Eberstadt of the American Enterprise Institute, "people will think twice about having another child.
McCartney found that EMI's (百代唱片) contractual clauses made it prohibitively expensive to follow suit, and the Beatles had to make do with the primitive technology of Abbey Road.

jushi.english: He gently refused to accept these expensive gifts.
jushi.chinese: 他委婉地拒绝了这些贵重的礼物。

jushi.english: Such expensive dresses are not available in ordinary department stores.
jushi.chinese: 这样昂贵的衣服在普通百货商店里是买不到的。

jushi.english: His books were bringing in royalties enough to enable him to live in a more expensive style.
jushi.chinese: 他的著作所获版税十分可观,足以使他过更为富裕的生活。
